page.title: 08MR.BERT PICKFORD'S LIFE
page.content: On Thursday 13th June Mr Bert Pickford told us about his life in Great Easton.His parents lived in the Bell, which was a public house at that time. They had cows and chickens.Every morning he would milk two cows then take them to the field.Then he would take the milk to the houses around Great Easton and his brother to Duton Hill.The milk was in a churn.The housewife would bring out a jam jar and he would fill it up.A 2lb jam jar =1pt. of milk.Then he went to school. After school he would take the cows home and milk them.He left school at 14 and went into his father's business.At that time they repaired farm carts and machinery.Later he restored old houses and converted old barns into houses for commuters.
